attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: Introduce a complaints commission that holds the UK press truly accountable
attributes.background: We petition to replace IPSO with a regulator that actually holds the UK press to account (similar to ofcom), and take measures such as not allowing a complete bias, active investigation of misleading headlines and apologies on the same scale as the original article. Regulation should be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The recent referendum campaign was an example of the how toxic the UK press have become and how well they are misinforming the UK public for ulterior motives. The fact that Rupert Murdoch can use the UK press to the to fulfill his own anti-EU agenda and at the same time maintain a friendship with our prime minister shows just how corrupt the whole system is.  To abide with IPSO is not even mandatory, and the more impartial press outlets refuse to be part of it out of protest of its uselessness.

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Change how the UK is governed to better serve and protect the British public.
attributes.background: Currently the key decision makers in the UK in the House of Lords are un-elected. They are appointed by being vetted by the Appointments Commission, then approved by the prime minister and formalised by the Queen. We feel that all aspects of our Government, especially key members should be elected.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that:

All members of the House of Lords are appointed by the public's vote only and each members term is subjected to a vote every 5 years.

If voted out, their position is to be replaced by a member elected by public vote.

Membership is to open to all current and former MP's.
 
If a MP is currently serving when elected to the House of Lords, their local position is to be replaced by a member of their own party. This member is to be elected by the people in their constituency only.

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and protect the NHS from further cuts
attributes.background: Over 70% of pensioners backed the Leave vote to force Britain out of the EU and likely into a recession. The taxpayer pays more for pensions, than for healthcare, but unlike health the 'triple lock' on pensions guarantees increases of at least 2.5%, inflation or average earnings, whichever is higher
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, £150bn was spent of taxpayer money on pensioners who voted to leave the EU. This looks certain to mean another recession and another round of austerity. The NHS can't take any more cuts, we were told during the referendum, so let's protect healthcare spending and cut pensions for those who clearly think we can afford a recession.
http://www.ukpublicspending.co.uk/budget_pie_ukgs.php

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: Overhaul The New GCSE's Making Them Easier For Students Sitting Them In 2017
attributes.background: The New GCSE's Have been declared 'too hard' by the exams regulator. Students will be sitting them around June 2017 and so far Mocks and Practice papers have shown the pass rate to be low! Others have quoted that a mark lower than 50% would be required to achieve an A Grade! They are just too hard.
attributes.additional_details:
We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard! 
Please read  the following BBC Article http://goo.gl/FCxYI7 The changes brought in my Michael Gove were exceptionally radical and don't allow children to achieve their fullest potential, Sign the petition to make the new GCSEs fairer for our kids and the leaders of the future.

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding £50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach £100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: Increase pressure to provide vital aid and evacution to the people of Aleppo.
attributes.background: The people of East Aleppo are being slaughtered. Before our very eyes via social media, hundreds are dying from the bombardment of the city. In recent days, the situation has become even more apocalyptic - the British Government simply must do more to help these people, by providing aid and escape.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Save Our Children's Centre's and say no to closures
attributes.background: Lot's of jobs are being cut to save money. If this is done then Children's Centres will be effected.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help try and save our centres....This is not only for the parents but also for every child and member of the community who uses these places on a day to day basis.

attributes.action: Ban Strobe Lighting at Events like concerts etc
attributes.background: In the UK 1 in 103 people suffer from a form of epilepsy. Epileptics should be able to enjoy live music, films, shows, clubs etc. I am not asking for the occasional strobe to be banned but I am asking that excessive strobe lighting be banned.

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's decision to 'ban' Lettings Agency applicant/tenant fees
attributes.background: The decision by the Government to 'ban' applicant/tenant fees is poorly conceived and of little benefit to tenants or the economy of the UK. In addition, this 'ban' goes against the very grain/ideology of a 'free market' economy.
attributes.additional_details: The announced plans to 'ban' (outright) the ability for Lettings Agencies to charge fees to applicants/tenants is based on a fundamental misunderstanding by the government as to how Lettings Agencies/Landlords are required to operate. The Government implies that tenants do not have a choice as to which property they wish to rent or which agency they wish to use, which displays an inherent lack of understanding as to how the property industry functions and what is required of it.

attributes.action: Stop all chain supermarkets selling eggs from battery and barn hens by 2018
attributes.background: We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.
attributes.additional_details: There are already systems being put into place by some stores, but these aren't expected to come into action for several years. We think that this change should happen quicker so that there is no more unnecessary suffering in the egg industry. We hope that by doing this the supermarkets will eventually eliminate all products that leave animals in terrible, cruel and inhumane situations.

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get
